title: Great British Bake-Off fans enraged by Rosie being axed before the final
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Rosie Brandreth-Poynter has been axed from Channel 4's Great British Bake off during Tuesday's quarter final episode.

The 28-year-old vet was unable to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith during Patisserie week.

Bake-Off fans were left enraged with the decision and took to Twitter to share their upset.

One annoyed viewer wrote: "'Rosie woz robbed! She won the technical against all odds and made some actual patisserie in patisserie week! David made a wonky root-veg slab-cabin inside some kind of Scientology chapel.She woz robbed I tells ya!"

"Ludicrously and very Britishly annoyed about Alice beating Rosie to the final of #gbbo and getting Star Baker. SHE CAME ACTUAL LAST IN THE TECHNICAL. And Rosie came first! Does that mean nothing anymore? *shakes fist and curses*," penned a enraged fan.

(Image: Channel 4)

Another typed: "so angry that at Paul and Prue’s closing comment on David, alludding to ; if Rosie hadn’t f***ked her showcase then David would definitely be going home. You judged Rosie to leave; what is wrong with you?"

One social media user shared: "sorry to see Rosie go. Such a nice, gentle person.And a wonderful baker. And a vet! That showstopper challenge was so difficult it should have been the final! Alice's ocean cake blew me away. So sorry to see Rosie go #GBBO #GBBO2019."

A micro-blogger quizzed: "why do the judges always criticise bakes to the bakers faces then do a 180 in the behind the scenes chit chat bit?? like yeah rosie was the worst in the showstopper but across all 3 she def didn't get the worst feedback and i don't think she should have gone."

Tuesday instalment saw the four semi-finalists Rosie, David, Alice and Steph tasked with a Technical task which meant whisking up tartlets followed by being told to create an epic Showstopper.

(Image: Channel 4)

(Image: Channel 4)

The foursome had to make a pastry encased in an edible glass case that had to be transparent.

David made a Greenhouse with edible moss inside but judge Paul said it resembled “a stack of sponges.”

Rosie’s petite cakes also did not receive the best feedback as she was told they were “simplistic.”

However, the Somerset native seemed to turn things around when she presented a Gateau Saint Honoré - after making a second attempt.

(Image: Channel 4)

Alice’s ranked fourth in the Technical challenge followed by Steph. In second place was David and Rosie won the challenge - but her Showstopper was not up to scratch which led to her being booted off.

Next week will see Alice, David and Steph battle it out in the tent to be crowned the winner of Bake Off 2019.

The Great British Bake Off continues on Tuesday nights on Channel 4 at 8pm.
description: Rosie said goodbye to the tent after coming last on Patisserie Week
